title: Limitation of liability for heavy fuel oil
context: [ยง128D-6.5] Limitation of liability for heavy fuel oil releases. (a) Notwithstanding any law to the contrary, the liability of any person under section 128D-6 for any release of heavy fuel oil from a tank barge carrying heavy fuel oil interisland shall not exceed $700,000,000. (b) For the purposes of subsection (a): &ldquo;Heavy fuel oil&rdquo; includes petroleum that is no. 6 technical grades of fuel oil and other grades such as navy special fuel oil and bunker C. &ldquo;Release of heavy fuel oil&rdquo; means a release subject to the federal Oil Pollution Act of 1990. &ldquo;Tank barge&rdquo; means any vessel that carries oil in bulk as cargo or in residue and is not equipped with a means of self propulsion. [L 1996, c 315, ยง1]
